reference_a:
@inproceedings{wang2016,
  title = {{{CrossCheck}}: {{Toward}} passive sensing and detection of mental health changes in people with schizophrenia},
  shorttitle = {{{CrossCheck}}},
  booktitle = {Proceedings of the 2016 {{ACM International Joint Conference}} on {{Pervasive}} and {{Ubiquitous Computing}}},
  author = {Wang, Rui and Aung, Min S. H. and Abdullah, Saeed and Brian, Rachel and Campbell, Andrew T. and Choudhury, Tanzeem and Hauser, Marta and Kane, John and Merrill, Michael and Scherer, Emily A. and Tseng, Vincent W. S. and Ben-Zeev, Dror},
  date = {2016-09-12},
  series = {{{UbiComp}} '16},
  pages = {886--897},
  publisher = {Association for Computing Machinery},
  location = {New York, NY, USA},
  doi = {10.1145/2971648.2971740}
}
reference_b:
@article{adler2022,
  title = {Machine learning for passive mental health symptom prediction: {{Generalization}} across different longitudinal mobile sensing studies},
  shorttitle = {Machine learning for passive mental health symptom prediction},
  author = {Adler, Daniel A. and Wang, Fei and Mohr, David C. and Choudhury, Tanzeem},
  date = {2022-04-27},
  journaltitle = {PLOS ONE},
  shortjournal = {PLOS ONE},
  volume = {17},
  number = {4},
  pages = {e0266516},
  publisher = {Public Library of Science},
  issn = {1932-6203},
  doi = {10.1371/journal.pone.0266516}
}
participants: adults with diagnosis of schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, or psychosis
additional_comments: CrossCheck study; More raw unaggregated data available; data preaggregated by Adler et al.; number of max. time points taken as maximum in aggregated data; raw time stamp for passive sensing but not for ESM

features.name: calm
features.coding:
Have you been feeling calm?
0 = not at all
3 = extremely
features.wording: Have you been feeling CALM?
features.construct: calmness, positive affect, affect, schizophrenia, psychopathology
features.comments: used as symptom of schizophrenia by tauthors

features.name: depressed
features.coding:
Have you been depressed?
0 = not at all
3 = extremely
features.wording: Have you been DEPRESSED?
features.construct: depression, neuroticism, personality, affect, negative affect, schizophrenia, psychopathology
features.comments: used as symptom of schizophrenia by tauthors

features.name: harm
features.coding:
Have you been worried about people trying to harm you?
0 = not at all
3 = extremely
features.wording: Have you been worried about people trying to HARM you?
features.comments: used as symptom of schizophrenia by tauthors

features.name: hopeful
features.coding:
Have you been hopeful about the future?
0 = not at all
3 = extremely
features.wording: Have you been HOPEFUL about the future?
features.comments: used as symptom of schizophrenia by tauthors

features.name: seeing_things
features.coding:
Have you been seeing things other people can't see?
0 = not at all
3 = extremely
features.wording: Have you been SEEING THINGS other people can’t see?
features.comments: used as symptom of schizophrenia by tauthors

features.name: sleeping
features.coding:
Have you been sleeping well?
0 = not at all
3 = extremely
features.wording: Have you been SLEEPING well?
features.comments: used as symptom of schizophrenia by tauthors

features.name: social
features.coding:
Have you been social?
0 = not at all
3 = extremely
features.wording: Have you been SOCIAL?
features.comments: used as symptom of schizophrenia by tauthors

features.name: stressed
features.coding:
Have you been stressed?
0 = not at all
3 = extremely
features.wording: Have you been feeling STRESSED?
features.construct: stress, negative affect, affect, schizophrenia, psychopathology
features.comments: used as symptom of schizophrenia by tauthors

features.name: think_clearly
features.coding:
Have you been able to think clearly?
0 = not at all
3 = extremely
features.wording: Have you been able to THINK clearly?
features.construct: mental clarity, cognitive functioning, schizophrenia, psychopathology
features.comments: used as symptom of schizophrenia by tauthors

features.name: voices
features.coding:
Have you been bothered by voices?
0 = not at all
3 = extremely
features.wording: Have you been bothered by VOICES?
features.comments: used as symptom of schizophrenia by tauthors
